p: In Brazil, the first DENV-4 cases leading to this serotype spread nationwide, occurring in Roraima and Amazonas in 2010, about 30 years after its first detection in the country [ 6]. In 2012, DENV-4 was prevalent and detected in 63% of the cases reported in Brazil [ 7]. Despite the highest notification in 2013 (1,452,289 cases), DENV-4 circulation was associated with mild cases [ 8, 9], but severe and fatal cases due to DENV-4 were also reported [ 10]. Although there has been no definitive association of the different DENV serotypes within the clinical course of the disease, it has been suggested that DENV-2 and DENV-3 are more frequently associated with severe disease [ 11].
